sen.e: Masaruko was in Emperor Nijyo's favor, but she sorrowed that she didn't become a priest when Emperor Konoe died, and the reentry into the inner palace was not by her will; she wrote a the poem `I have had so many difficulties, yet came back to the palace and view the moon that used to be the moon I once viewed '("Heike Monogatari (The Tale of the Heike)").

sen.e: However, Masaruko reentered into the inner palace just after the Heiji War was over, under abnormal situation; there is a view that it was the political marriage in order to control her father and Goshirakawa (he is the successor of Emperor Toba and Emperor Konoe) in that Bifukumonin who was the guardian of Emperor Nijyo and the aides of Emperor Nijyo; FUJIWARA no Tsunemune, FUJIWARA no Korekata didn't interfere in this.
